Review title: Pompeii is no longer a high-quality movie
Review_body: Pompeii is a below average movie directed by Paul Anderson. The plot is built upon a fragile biblical story that questions both the historical evidence and the expectations of the viewer. The background of the movie is set in 79 ADs. The life in the city of Pompeii during that period was ostentatious. The protagonist, Milo, dreams of the day when he can redeem his freedom and marry the daughter of his master. Because of the severe debt crisis, his master promised his daughter to a Roman Senator as a refund. Milo decides to risk his life as a gladiator and try to find his beloved. At the same time, the city of Pompeii is going to take up one of the greatest natural disasters of all time. The movie tried to portray the value of true love, tragedy and recovery, but failed pathetically. The leading characters, Milo and Cassia, did not even get time to know each other. Viewers can also notice the lack of development in their relationship. In short, Pompeii is no longer a high-quality movie. The movie director stuffed the movie with the typical Hollywood hackneyed. However, those who appreciate 3D effects and other movie gimmicks should watch this movie.

I didn't have terribly high hopes for this so I was very pleasantly surprised. No, it probably won't win an Oscar, but come on, let's be honest--do we really care about that? The effects were good, the city was beautiful, the story wasn't stellar but wasn't awful either; the romance had a couple twilighty lines but overall not too sappy. Honestly, there really wasn't time for sap, and I for one am always grateful for that. the name Milo seemed like a weird choice but who knows maybe it really is a Celtic name. The sets were pretty magnificent and the portrayal of the cataclysm was thrilling and devastating. For anyone who cares, the movie was also surprisingly clean. It was an exciting epic action movie with no graphic nudity or sex. There was violence of course, but nothing graphic or gross. The only thing arguably gratuitous was Kit Harrington's prominently chiseled abs, but no one at the theater seemed to mind. I did some quick research after watching and was surprised to discover how accurate the portrayal was. They of course took some dramatic license with the explosions and lava bombs and the size of the tidal wave, but several archaeologists and historians affirmed that it was overall a pretty decent portrayal of Pompeii and its destruction. The music was also pretty awesome. I bought the soundtrack. A few people commented negatively on the opening and closing frames of the film and admittedly, my first reaction was "huh." But after thinking about it and reading about the real disaster, I understand why they chose to do it. Those were the stories the filmmakers were telling--the people who were left behind. Even the main couple were inspired by a couple found in the ruins. In a nutshell, don't expect Russell Crowe and Gladiator quality and don't expect a documentary either, but enjoy it for what it is. I'll be buying it when it comes out on blu ray.

I suppose that when you have the opportunity to vote on a scale of one to ten for a movie you think should get a zero, you feel doubly cheated after hoping to spend some productive time with a bag of popcorn. Pompeii was a phenomenal waste of time and money and talent (except for Kit Harrington). I don't watch movies with ratings under ★★★, so I figured it would be okay to see Pompeii, as this movie had been given the same IMDb rating as The Monuments Men, which I had seen and thoroughly enjoyed during the same weekend.I suppose that if you ignore historical and scientific facts when you create a movie based on the premise of two volcanic ash-covered corpses frozen in time to be discovered by an archaeological dig, you can also discourage casting, special effects, acting, and script-writing.When Pompeii was finally over, I couldn't help thinking about how Kiefer Sutherland in his role as Senator Corvus epitomized the effective experience of this movie — bloated and inarticulate.

...and at least that was MEANT to be funny! Supposed to be an epic tale set around a major historical even... but seriously, this is nothing but a piece of over-hyped horrendous crap! The visuals of course are great but you just wish that they had taken 1% of the effect cost and spent it on plot writing. Even early Van Damme movies have deeper story lines than this epic mess, that has no idea what it wants to be, and ends up failing grossly as a disaster movie, as a gladiator movie, as a historical movie, as a love story, as a revenge flick and even as a simple action movie.Almost every single scene is absolutely ridiculous and unbelievable and many are downright laughable. There is little need to go through the "story" because it makes very little sense and character building is non-existent.I honestly cannot recall every seeing a movie containing this many clichés. It is really annoying considering the major budget but I strongly advise against anyone wasting their time on this - even out of curiosity.Peace!

Review title: My personal feeling about this film. :)
Review_body: I LOVED it and I lOVED the "message" it gave. Just beautiful....it touched my heart. From the very beginning of this film I was captivated. I am not here to give my critique on the actors because I feel that they all played their roles with the integrity and nitty gritty that some deserved. Some portrayed the beautiful scenes well too. A truly heartbreaking piece of history that has intrigued me and still does of how the people of Pompeii lived and died.Good will always prevail.That final kiss at the end.....Say no more.... :) x

I read plenty of reviews which scared me away. Then I read one which shed some light and led me to finally watching it. If you are watching this for history reasons, then don't bother. But if your watching this movie to be entertained (...you know, like watching a MOVIE) then it does its job. The only thing I found out of place was Kiefer Sutherland (who had a fade haircut back in those days?).Otherwise the acting was okay, and there wasn't too much cheese (no cheesy jokes, thankfully). If you want a pure gladiator style movie, then watch Gladiator, Troy, or Clash of the Titans (another one people hated, but I liked) first, but I would recommend Pompeii. Go into with no expectations. It won't disappoint you but it won't knock your socks off.

The movie is full of clichè and bad stereotypes. They could have told more about of a flourishing city/civilization; instead the decide to follow the same old story plots over and over again mixing a bad copy of the Gladiator that meets Titanic seasoned with the typical natural disaster movie. Stereotypes:-The good poor Celtic kid that get his family killed and village destroyed by the evil uncivilized Roman legions that enjoy exterminating tribes and peasants. -Any ancient Rome movie has to begin in rainy Britannia right? -Romans are depicted As Nazis. -The black man (gladiator) is the first to die. -The nanny of the rich dame (who's also dark) is the second to die. -The Evil Senator who also fights as a warrior that wants to marry the girl who of course fell in love with the gladiator from Britannia. -the city of Pompeii is not spectacular at all in some parts it even looks like it's made of plaster and carton boxes -the disaster is not even realistic: the city survived 2000 years because it was covered by dust and the temperature together with gases killed the entire population that didn't even had the time to realize what was happening; there were no scenes of assaulting ships, Tsunami or packing running citizens. (Romans soldiers are depicted again as The Nazis of the past killing civilians to get a place on the sailing ships).They could have told the story of a magnificent city and of one of the greatest and most advanced civilizations in history: with public baths, fast foods, theaters, aqueducts, sewers, universities, civil engineering, commerce and the most advanced law code of all.The only concept they should have borrowed from the Gladiator is: "...I've seen the rest of the world and is dark, cruel and brutal. Rome is the light.."

In what can aptly be described as Titanic meets Gladiator, a Briton orphan becomes a full time gladiator, part time horse whisperer, and occasional eye-candy. After meeting a progressive Roman lady, whom is completely unaware of her Roman privilege, our hero discovers the meaning of love and, a reason to live. Enter the magic Negro also doubling as gladiator, who goes from being our hero's adversary to becoming his brother in arms. All dreams are thwarted by a pesky volcano. A tidal wave gives freedom of the seas to the magic Negro character and countless of slaves. But not all is lost, somehow every person who has visited injustices upon our hero is in Pompei too and he manages to kill them all while saving Snow White of Pompeii Valley just seconds before their love is preserved for eternity- this time neither one "ever let go". Their ordeal ends with probably the hottest kiss in history.

Pompeii: Few place names evoke such thoughts of human tragedy on a colossal scale. There are many works of literature and film that capture the enormity of the events of 2,000 years ago. I am afraid for me this film is definitely NOT one of them.I have rarely felt so resentful about wasting time and money on a film. This is my first IMDb review triggered by these strong feelings. The reason for such an extremely strong reaction:Having read or watched so many good pieces of work about Pompeii the historical liberties taken really jarredThe script was all over the show. It tried to cover multiple plot lines and themes in a rush, did not explore or develop them and thus did none of them justice. It seemed to rely on copying other movies' themes and assuming the audience would settle for an abbreviated version in this movie ... (revenge for killed family, horse whispering, citizen falling for a slave, men due to fight to the death become friends, powerful politician demanding to marry daughter of parents who want to protect her). If Artificial Intelligence software was asked to write the script it would probably be like this - all the components but no soul.The acting was okay but there were not enough script opportunities for the cast to build real characters. (What was going on with Kiefer's accent? It sounded like he was test driving a new pair of dentures. Was it the old "baddies speak public school English" thing going on?)The special effects were not very special in 2D but may have been spectacular in 3D. The timing of effects seemed to support the looser plot strands but did not really build the atmosphere. For a disaster movie the edge of my seat was not occupied as much as hoped. Probably suspension of disbelief had been lost before the effects kicked in.As a love story, this was more casual quick fling between bored students in the second year at college than deep, yearning, heartfelt passion of destinies entwined.The ending - unintentionally hilarious is probably not the desired effect from "Gladiator meets Titantic" but it was either a laugh or a yawn moment.

Review title: A half assed job of a movie full of clichés
Review_body: The only good thing about this movie was Kit Harrington's abs and the special effects. They could have done so much with the story. There were some great scenes (i.e. the escape to the mountain) that they could have developed further and the actors could have developed their characters further, too. The love story was just filled with clichés. I don't know what the director was thinking with this plot. Both the love story and the fact that there is a volcano exploding should have been explored further. All themes were simply touched upon and I was left thinking "That's it?" and I didn't get the usual satisfaction I would from the cheesy romance element. Honestly, don't waste your time.

Kit Harington 10/10 !! Plot? What plot?? And who cares??!Story full of romance, drama, fight, blood, flesh and muscle.... (and yes we are talking about toned Mr Kit Harington muscle mainly; although there are other male characters that try to rival). We all know the story about Pompeii, so you can't really expect a happy ending unless you are a real optimist... but watching this movie you can't help but hope till the last minute that there will be some kind of exception for the happy couple and miracle is about to happen as usually does when Hollywood try to re-write the history. Warning: there might be few wet tissues by the end of the movie. Nough said....

Review title: You will love it if you love history.
Review_body: It's a movie based on the history of Mount Vesuvius. It erupted AD 79 and it's lava destroyed entire Pompeii. In this movie, you will see the love of the destruction. As I love history, I loved this movie so much. May be I'll go there to visit Pompeii someday. You will observe something different in this movie.

This movie is a poorly done rip-off of the movie Gladiator. Some scenes and even lines of the dialogue are clearly taken directly from Gladiator as is the general plot. Some blatant examples of copying Gladiator are the scene where Atticus discusses seeing his family in the afterlife, Milo throwing his weapon at Kiefer's character, they call Milo "the Kelt" similar to "the Spainard", blood dripping from his hand being the focus in the final fight scene, etc. Unless you for some reason really want to see a volcano watch Gladiator instead, even if you've seen it.The acting is bad especially by Kiefer Sutherland.
